explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004). Classified into Class 8 (UN#2280 (solid)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 305degC (ICSC, 2004).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 23 - 41degC (ICSC 2004), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though the substance acts on many metals in the presence of water according to ICSC (2004). Classified into "Corrosive Substances" by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods. However, the category includes skin corrosivity, and it is unclear whether the substance is classified as "metal" corrosive (UN#2280 (solid)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 772mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 980mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 98-6 (1999)), 1,127mg/kg (SIDS (1996)), 750mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)) and 800mg/kg (SIDS (1996)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 1,110mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on several skin irritation tests with rabbits (SIDS (1996)): "Corrosive" (though the results are not those of 4-hour application). Also based on the description of the human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)): "Corrosive to the eye, skin and respiratory tract." The substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on eye irritation tests with rabbits (SIDS (1996)): "Corrosive." Also based on the description of the human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)): "Corrosive to the eye, skin and respiratory tract."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the description of the human health effects: "Skin sensitization: positive," "induces allergic dermatitis." The substance is thus considered to possess a potential for sensitization for human skin, though guinea pig skin sensitization tests show negative (CERI Hazard Data 98-6 (1999) and SIDS (1996)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), described in SIDS (1996) and NTP DB (Access on March 2006).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible given the insufficiency of data for use in classification, along with the absence of existing classification.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of reduced birth rates and delayed ossification in the filial generation at doses causing parental toxicity, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004), ACGIH (7th, 2001) and SIDS (1996).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (respiratory system, nervous system, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "corrosive to the eye, skin and respiratory tract; inhalation may cause pulmonary edema." (ICSC (1998)), and the evidence from animal studies including "reduced locomotor activity, salivation, diarrhea and tremor; congestion of the kidney observed at necropsy" (CERI Hazard Data 98-6 (1996)), "decreased mobility, hyperpnoea and tremor" (SIDS (1996)). The ICSC study provides some evidence of human health effects under the heading of short-term exposure. However, the substance is classified into Category 2 since the priority rating of the study is 2, together with the absence of supporting case reports and information as to whether the effects are those of single exposure. The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (respiratory system, liver), Category 2 (blood system, kidney)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, liver) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, kidney)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "irritation of the conjunctiva/upper respiratory tract and acute hepatitis" (CERI Hazard Data 98-6 (1999)), and the evidence from animal studies including "increased number of inflammatory cells in the nasal cavity, squamous epithelial hyperplasia of the respiratory epithelium, squamous epithelial hyperplasia and inflammatory cellular infiltration of the subepithelium in the trachea; alveolar decay, interstitial fibrosis, infiltration of the inflammatory cells in the lung" (CERI Hazard Data 98-6 (1999)), "sneezing, nasal catarrh and rale," "anemia accompanied by decreased WBC, degenerative changes in the kidney and liver" (SIDS (1996)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 72 hours ErC50=19mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals (2002) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by TOC: 96.9%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.35(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
